sentence.Network_en: With gin at 9p a tot, getting plastered is cheap and easy.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (originally dialect): of unknown origin
mid 18th cent.: from archaic tot 'set of figures to be added up', abbreviation of total or of Latin totum 'the whole'
late 19th cent.: from slang tot 'bone', of unknown origin

entry.def: A tot is a very young child.
A tot of a strong alcoholic drink such as whisky or brandy is a small amount of it in a glass.

means.word_mean: 1. a small amount (especially of a drink);

sentences.sentence: "Add all the people in this town to those of the neighboring town"
